Sentencas: A number of ternary transition metal sulfides with general composition AB(2)S(4) (where A and B are different transition metal atoms) have been prepared and investigated as potential anode catalysts for use in H2S powered solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Synthesis and characterization of new ternary transition metal sulfide anodes for H2S-powered solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: For the initial screening, polarization resistance of the materials was measured in a two electrode symmetrical cell at 700-850 degrees C. Vanadium-based materials showed the lowest polarization resistance, and so were chosen for subsequent full cell tests using the configuration [H2S, AV(2)S(4)/YSZ/Pt, air] (where A = Ni, Cr, Mo).
Titulo: Synthesis and characterization of new ternary transition metal sulfide anodes for H2S-powered solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: MoV2S4 anode had superior activity and performance in the full cell setup, consistent with results from symmetrical cell tests.
Titulo: Synthesis and characterization of new ternary transition metal sulfide anodes for H2S-powered solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Polarization curves showed MoV2S4 had the lowest potential drop, With up to a 200 mA cm(-2)
Titulo: Synthesis and characterization of new ternary transition metal sulfide anodes for H2S-powered solid oxide fuel cell

Titulo: Synthesis and characterization of new ternary transition metal sulfide anodes for H2S-powered solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: 275 mW cm(-2) at 800 degrees C was obtained with a pure H2S stream.
Titulo: Synthesis and characterization of new ternary transition metal sulfide anodes for H2S-powered solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Polarization resistance of materials was a strong function of current density, and showed a sharp change of slope attributable to a change in the rate-limiting step of the anode reaction mechanism.
Titulo: Synthesis and characterization of new ternary transition metal sulfide anodes for H2S-powered solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: MoV2S4 was chemically stable during prolonged (10 days) exposure to H2S at 850 degrees C, and fuel cell performance was stable during Continuous 3-day operation at 370 mA cm(-2) current density.
Titulo: Synthesis and characterization of new ternary transition metal sulfide anodes for H2S-powered solid oxide fuel cell
